Subinterfaces of ClusteringMethod in edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster
 interface BatchClusteringMethod<T extends Clusterable<T>>
          A clustering method that needs the complete set of samples on hand in order to operate.
 interface CentroidClusteringMethod<T extends Clusterable<T>>
          A clustering method which represents each cluster as a point (the "centroid"), which must be generated from a prototype and which has various stats associated with it

Uses of ClusteringMethod in edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.bayesian
 

Classes in edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.bayesian that implement ClusteringMethod
 class BayesianClustering<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
          Performs cluster classification with a naive bayesian classifier
 class KNNClustering<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
          k-Nearest Neighbor classifier.
 class LabelDecomposingBayesianClustering<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
          Performs a simple unsupervised clustering on all the samples with a given label in an attempt to decompose the label-level cluster into several smaller clusters.
 class MultiNeighborClustering<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
          Note we use CentroidClusters internally, but th e centroids are in fact just the training samples, not new prototype-based centroids

 class OnlineAgglomerativeClustering<T extends Clusterable<T>>
          Agglomeratively cluster points in an online manner.
 class OnlineHierarchicalClusteringMethod<T extends Clusterable<T>>
          This is a supervised method because after the tree is built, new unknown samples can be placed on it and labels inferred.
 class RandomOrderedBatchAgglomerativeClusteringMethod<T extends Clusterable<T>>
          This is a sort of hierarchical k-means
